heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 03 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (178°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 493 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 309.2m lower than yesterday, 262.7m lower than the past week, 492.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 809m to a maximum of 2820m, averaging 1174.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1436.7m and 1666.9m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
